result.execSummary:
All charges against David B. Clemence in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David B. Clemence is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David B. Clemence

records.addlTxt:
2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David B. Clemence appeared by video. Attorney Richard John Shawl in court for David B. Clemence. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived - would like to appear in person. Pfeifer to prepare order to transport. Bail continued. adj. 02:36 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 004781,
Payable Number: 107957,
Receipt Number: 22R 004369,
Amount: $20.00
notified Scott, ONSO - Initial Appearance from Winnebago Mental Health Institution - Notified Scott, ONSO - did not have warrant - notified DA's office
Follow all conditions of any Chapter 51 Commitment Order

9:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David B. Clemence appeared by video from the Winnebago Mental Health Institution. Court states Defendant placed in Mental Health Institution involuntarily from a Vilas County case. Defendant has not seen copy of complaint. Court goes over charge, right to counsel. Defendant statement to being sworn in. Court explains this is not an evidentiary hearing. Defendant states would like  counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Defendant does not know how long he will be in Winnebago. Court verifies Defendant's address. Court sets bond. Court explains options of appearing at next hearing. Defendant statement to charges. adj. 09:42 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David B. Clemence not in court.  
Defendant has not yet had an initial on this case - subject to Vilas county chpt 51 and detained in Winnebago, but has not yet received any further information from attorney for defendant in Vilas case. 
Pfeifer statement - Request warrant.  Court authorizes warrant at this time.
